habitat_description: Abert’s Towhee is a non-migratory species, inhabiting a permanent territory concealed by dense shrubs (Tweit and Finch 1994). The preferred habitat includes riparian cottonwood-willow with a dense understory of shrubs (Rosenberg et al. 1991), mesquite woodland (Marshall 1960), but this species has adapted to mixed exotic-native habitat (Rosenberg et al. 1987), remnants of riparian woods, shrubs, and marshes (Rosenberg et al. 1991), as well as urban and agricultural habitats (Rosenberg et al. 1991, Tweit and Finch 1994).
